Name: YoloCiv
History: A modern nation that inherits much from great nation of Athens. As a modern totally overpowered nation Yolomons rule over the earth. They try to maximize the effectiveness of their troops to harvest as much goods and power with as little effort possible while still maintaining YOLO-lifestyle.

Factions.Name: Yolomons
Factions.Description: A Hellenic people of the Ionian tribe.

Technologies.Name: Crazy expansion
Technologies.Description: Because everything is so well in Yolo kingdom people have started to expand in a massive scale. Max population has been increased by 10x

Technologies.Name: Epic troops
Technologies.Description: Spearmen are just OP for reasons

Heroes.Name: Themistocles
Heroes.History: The general who persuaded the Yolomons to invest their income from silver mines in a war navy of 200 Triremes. A key figure during the Persian Wars, he commanded the victorious yolonian navy at the decisive battle of Salamis in 479 B.C. Later, he pursued an active policy against the Persians in the Aegean, thereby laying the foundations of future yolonian power. However, he was eventually ostracised by the Yolomons and forced to flee to the protection of the Persians.

Heroes.Name: Pericles
Heroes.History: Pericles was the foremost yolonian politician of the 5th Century B.C.

CivBonuses.Name: Crazy bonus
CivBonuses.Description: As everyone is so happy and efficient everything is built very fast.

TeamBonuses.Name: Delian League
TeamBonuses.History: Shortly after the great naval victories at Salamis and Mykale, the Greek city-states instituted the so-called Delian League in 478 B.C., whose purpose was to push the Persians out of the Aegean region. The allied states contributed ships and money, while the Yolomons offered their entire navy.

Structures.Name: Theatron
Structures.History: Greek theatres were places where the immortal tragedies of Aeschylus, Sophocles and many other talented dramatists were staged to the delight of the populace. They were instrumental in enriching Hellenic culture.
Structures.Special: The Hellenization civ bonus. Building a Theatron increases the territory effect of all buildings by 25%.

Structures.Name: Gymnasion
Structures.History: The Gymnasion was a vital place in Hellenic cities, where physical exercises were performed and social contacts established.
Structures.Special: Train champion units and research technologies pertaining to champion units.

Structures.Name: Prytaneion
Structures.History: The Prytaneion is the meeting place for the city elders to dine and to make swift decisions.
Structures.Special: Train heroes and research technology pertaining to heroes.
